caption.p: Areas with mean monthly temperatures suitable for malaria transmission as predicted by the model of Mordecai et al. ( 2013). Suitability is shown under the current climate (see Materials and Methods), on a blue–red scale, from too cold for transmission (blue), through peak optimal transmission (white), to too hot for transmission (red). The aridity mask, where the area is unsuitable for mosquito development, is shown in grey and centered on the Sahara desert. ( Inset) The area of land (in km 2 × 10 6) in each month, within each quantile of transmission suitability, as described in the text.
